subject: Personal Finance
title: Anchoring and Prices
description: A 60-second lesson on Anchoring and Prices.

hook.text: A store puts a $500 jacket next to a $200 one. Suddenly $200 feels like a bargain.

buildup.text: Anchoring is when the first number you see sets your reference point for everything after.

discovery.text: Tversky and Kahneman proved that even random numbers influence financial estimates.

twist.text: Real estate agents use this. Show an overpriced house first, and the next one looks cheap.

climax.text: Menu designers place expensive items at the top so the rest feels reasonable.

quiz.question: What is 'anchoring' in behavioral economics?
options: The first number you see shapes your judgment
